creditline: Gift of Ruth and Bruce Dayton
description: brown; 19 round feet; center unglazed on top and bottom; has its own box
medium: Yue ware Stoneware with celadon glaze
text: Ceramic inkstones with green glazes have been retrieved from numerous Six Dynasties (220–581) tomb burials. This one is raised on several droplet-shaped legs with incised decor. The deep groove (biyong 辟雍) encircling the round, unglazed grinding surface acts as the inkwell.
title: Multiple-legged Inkstone
